page.title: 02Saint Mary's Church
page.content: This is the only Saxon Church of cruciform design in the north of England. Though much of the original church has been altered or rebuilt, the tower and transepts remain largely unaltered and date from 1020. This is the Mother church of Stockton. A Chapel of Ease was built in Stockton in 1237 and the Chapelry of Stockton became a separate parish in 1713. Today we have 10 daughter churches in the area. This is an ancient Collegiate Church. From 1085 until 1536 this church was served by a College of Clergy consisting of a Vicar and 10 Canons. This church illustrates the history of architecture. The tower and transepts are Saxon, the nave was enlarged in 1190 and the chancel was rebuilt about 1250.
